name: Novotel Beaune

reviews.text: I booked this hotel in a complete panic after driving to the south of France, instead of flying as our flights were cancelled on 10th August.
reviews.title: PERFECT FOR A ONE NIGHT STOP!

likes.liked: — IT WAS SITUATED BETWEEN CALAIS AND CANNES!
likes.disliked: — SLIGHTLY STERILE, THERE ARE FAR MORE BEAUTIFUL HOTELS HERE BUT SUITED OUR NEEDS.

reviews.text: I have to say, that after looking at the pictures of the hotel, they are slightly deceiving.
reviews.title: Very nice

reviews.text: Our family of four (15 year old & 11 year old) were winding up 23 day drive through Europe, on way back to Paris. This was stopover stay to break up drive, so we booked "chain" hotel just for night versus all our other hotels on trip were 4-star hotels (non chain names). Our expectations were low, because we figured it would be run-down Holiday Inn type experience.
reviews.title: Great Surprise; Excellent Value; Reccomend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Driving up, we could see building is new and modern; check in was efficient; we had two connecting rooms {which by the way is hard to book through online interface, but give Novotel credit}. Rooms were clean and modern! We were thrilled when we opened doors to our rooms and did first look inspection. These rooms were better than many of the 4-star rooms we had been staying in.
reviews.title: good hotel
A great place to stay.
reviews.text: There was coffee in the room, this is pet peave of mine that most the 4-star hotels had no coffee so we had to buy our own hot water heater and instant coffee for travelling. But Novotel had it! Internet access in room, while not free was 9.90 euros for 24 hours which is somewhat reasonable compared to the 50 swiss francs ($50) for 135 minutes I had to pay in Saanen, Switz..
Room had A/C. Alot of rooms we had been to did not have A/c.
reviews.title: Can't fault it

likes.liked: — Well-located for motorway and the food!

reviews.text: Pool is basic rectangle, but adequate for kids.
reviews.title: Great restaurant & staff

reviews.text: Located on outskirts of Beaune and very easy to find from motorway. We stopped for one night on our way to the Alps and were impressed by our spacious clean family room . Free wifi and nice outdoor swimming pool. The hotel staff were welcoming and professional. We felt it offered good value and would certainly stay there again.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: Clean, quiet and spacious room with view of the pool.
reviews.title: Nice and neat
Novotel Beaune
reviews.text: The city centre is about 45 minutes by foot and 5 minutes by car. The hotel itself is located on a street with other hotels and (ley-key)restaurants.

reviews.title: Professional and Friendly Staff makes a good stay
reviews.text: When we were there, most of the guests seemed to be tourists on their way back home.

reviews.text: This was our second stop en route to the Alps. Can concur with others that its conveniently just off the motorway, clean, good sized rooms, very friendly service at the desk and in the restaurant, and a good buffet breakfast with a very good range. It is a little dated compared to newer Accor hotels we stayed at, and the room lay out is not as imaginative as others - and its in the middle of an industrial estate and so not easy to walk anywhere nice - so its a business and travel hotel primarily - but a fine one. Beane looked well worth a work around, though parking looked to be an issue - and there is a good centre commercial with a big Carrefour 5 mins drive away so convenient for picking up shopping in your way to your final destination
reviews.title: Good convenient stop
Half way stop between Normandie and Nice!
reviews.text: I was looking for a half way house 6 hour drive from Normandy to Nice. The Novotel which I chose on the Internet fulfilled my expectations with a nice room, proper restaurant and bar and a decent breakfast the next morning before my depart for Nice. However, a Cote de Boeuf at Eur 8 supplement was over the top and the restaurant staff were ignorant of the wines they were serving and how - which right next door to some of the finest Burgundy wine growers is inexcusable!! I can only assume staff training is lacking on the finer points of restaurant service - however, the chef is to be recommended and the meal I had was excellent, though perhaps a little rushed? Reception was first class and the desk staff helpful. I don't know how good their English was but hopefully OK. I'm not entirely convinced I'd stay there again for just one night as the room and meals cost me Eur 210, which in French francs is 1373 !! The Burgundy I asked for was dreary and very ordinary at Eur 24 and no better than a carafe table wine - I think its probably this that has left me with a slightly negative impression, but as a Hotel it was fine. I guess it all depends on what your budget is for a one night stay and a decent meal?

The Hotel is located about 300 meters from the motorway and just through the toll booth. The lobby is clean and welcoming, however, the rooms are dated but offer the basics, with the addition of an in expensive mini bar.
reviews.title: European Motorway Journey

reviews.text: Numerous restaurants are within a short walking distance, although the paths are patchy and the lightly terrible if you venture toward them.
reviews.title: very good value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel in my opinion is over priced when their are about 8 /9 other budget hotels within a 400m radius, that offer what most people want when travelling, simply a bed. The breakfast was seriously lacking, with a very limited continental option, which for the 15 pound price is ridiculous. Had, I not already pre-paid for the breakfast I would not have had it.
reviews.title: short stay

reviews.text: This hotel offers the usual Accor/Novotel package - clean & comfortable family-sized rooms, bar, restaurant etc on site. It has an outdoor pool, but unheated!
reviews.title: Can't fault it - one of Novotel's best

likes.disliked: — Couldn't fault it. The town of Beaune was not as good as expected.

reviews.text: The staff & service were very efficient and particularly friendly.
reviews.title: Great stop on the way to the Alps

likes.liked: — Clean, friendly welcome, nice rooms, new fixtures, acceptable restaurant, gated parking lot
likes.disliked: — In business zone (no character, but near the highay so convenient!) Pool not heated.

reviews.text: The hotel is in a business area alongside another hotel, mid-way between Beaune centre and the autoroute - quick and easy to find off the autoroute and about 30 minutes walk into the centre for a decent choice of restaurants and bars. Ideal for an overnight stay if you prefer not to stay in the hotel for dinner. (It's not too remote and we felt safe walking back later in the evening).
reviews.title: novotel beaune

reviews.text: It is close to a busy roundabout, but this is well disguised by clever use of trees & bushes to screen the sight of traffic. I didn't notice any noise, and the garden and pool area was quite quiet and relaxing. anyway, you can't have easy access from the autoroute without having a busy road nearby.
reviews.title: Fantastic stopping point between Paris and Switzerland

likes.disliked: — Only the front desk help spoke any English! Luckily, I still speak some French.

reviews.text: Not a 5 star hotel, but I give it 5 stars for the price-quality ratio...
reviews.title: Just relaxing after a day of driving

reviews.text: We stayed here on our way south. Great location, just minutes from the motorway, yet you can't hear the noise at night. Lovely rooms, big and light with good facilities. Restaurant was OK. Good meal deal for children. Our meal was OK but nothing special. There was lots to choose from though, so perhaps we just ordered the wrong thing. Breakfast was excellent, superb choice. Would we stay here again, possibly, if the price was right. We got a deal on this occasion that included breakfast.
reviews.title: Super location and nice rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is excellent vfm at less than 100 euros. Very smart design, switched on check in, bright comfortable room. Ample free parking space. Quick access to the motorway. If like me you were on a wine trip you are ideally located on the south side of town - within minutes from Volnay and Mersault. The walk in to the centre of Beaune is probably about 20 - 25 minutes which I imagine will be a key factor for most visitors. If you want to be absolutely in the middle of the action then this hotel is not for you. Personally I believe it gets the balance just right.
reviews.title: Spot on

reviews.text: Typically Novotel-style hotel - rather modern, clean, excellent for families (kids under 16 stay for free in the parents room). Location is great - close to the highway, however without the noise. Perfect for stop-overs. Free and secure parking.
reviews.title: Comfortable rooms, average food, good location

reviews.text: Dinner was okay, prices also still acceptable, very kindly service - also for kids. There are no real alternatives around the hotel. You need to take your car for a larger choice of restaurants.
reviews.title: Good for a short stay if you are travelling through Beaune!

description: The Novotel Beaune is a 3 star hotel offering 127 spacious modern rooms. Located opposite vineyards, 2 km from the Hospices de Beaune and the historic town centre, the hotel boasts direct access via the A6 highway. Whether on business or holiday travels, your comfort and wellbeing are assured with our pool, gardens, restaurant, bar and free parking. The hotel offers 10 meeting rooms with a capacity totalling 180 people for your next conference or function. Welcome to the capital of Burgundy wines.
